column4: hello, im trying to ubuntu 10.10 32bit on a windows xp laptop. when i boot to cdrom, windows xp continues to own the laptop...
usb not an option
netboot not an option, no pxe
sounds like an issue with grub installer
oh?
i think its a bios proprietary issue,,, maybe your right, can you help assist in trbshting?
beyond me, but yes check bios setting
for usb try looking for usb options like enhanced or 2.0 vs 1.1
one moment ok,,, ActionParsnip for a second
explain. thanks
some pc do not show the option unless device is connected/has a disk in it
i tried usb install first before cd, usb first then cd always for me
on some pc I have to go into the boot options page (f-10 or 12) to see the cdrom as bootable
im done with the basics, i need the work around
might need to use the alternate cd
nope, been there done that,, your right, but im past that stage
make sure there is nothing that's 'protecting' your boot sector
have you used freebsd? that wouldnt even allow me to load it
last freebsd I used was 2.2.2
well,,, its improved since then lol
seen a few usb sticks that would not boot
regarding your mbr fix
